result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Widowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Maintain full time employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.  DNA Sample/Surcharge waived based on date of violation.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Widowski

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew J Widowski in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant advises the Court that he is no longer involved in Teen Challenge but is involved in other treatment.  The Defendant is ordered to apply at the public defender's officer and return back to court.  The Court recalls the case.  Attorney Kristie Gordon appears in person for the State.   The Defendant is sworn in and testifies.  The Court finds the Defendant is eligible and will appoint an attorney at the repayment rate of $50 per month commencing 7/1/16.
Hearing at 05-27-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Matthew J Widowski in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Defendant has advised the Court that he has not retained counsel yet.  The Defendant has enrolled in Teen Challenge and is expected to finish in May 2016.   The Defendant is to provide information about the Teen Challenge Program to the State.  Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
